reviewText: Being a big fan of Brooke Burke---after watching her on "Wild On!", buying the 2004 calendar, purchasing every FHM, Stuff or Maxim that had her on the cover...........I was happy to buy the DVD. However the DVD is just a poorly-done documentary on Brooke Burke, offering her annoying commentary over swimsuit shots done to a bad soundtrack. Like most other models, she is stuck-up, conceded, and too used to getting her own way and having no true challenges lying ahead of her. I'd take WWE's amazing Trish Stratus over Brooke anyday. Trish goes through much larger challenges than Brooke daily, in wrestling matches. Brooke wouldn't fare too well in that department. As for her looks, she is very very hot, but this DVD just brings it all down. It was truly a waste of money spent on this poor video.
Title: Barely Brooke

reviewText: First of all Brooke does not appear nude in this video, if you are looking to see Brooke \naked, like I did, you will not find it on this dvd. I spent $3, probably $3 I will never seeor should have saved to buy the playboy issue where she did come out naked. BUt mostly this dvdhas her talking about herself about how she thinks she is the center of the universe and sad to sayproducers of this dvd didnt inform her  that she is not. Anyhow the cover is a comeplete tease andfalse advertising, she is NOT topless and never appears. BROOKE might be hot but there are HOTTERgirls out there who are willing to take everything off and not just tease and perhaps along theway admit that they are not the center of the universe.
summary: DOn't waste your time or MONEY on this DVD
Title: Barely Brooke

reviewText: Brooke probably didn't do this video to show us her acting or singing abilities. She did it to market a very hot sultry brunette who even though she is getting older is one substantial bit of eye candy. I have watched this several times and still think she is quite the beauty
summary: This is a vid about a hot woman
Title: Barely Brooke

reviewerName: John S. Harris "The Voice of Reason"
reviewText: Brooke Burke.  Lovely girl. Can't act. Probably can't sing or dance, either.  All she can do is look hot in a swimsuit, but she does that very well.Problem is, this DVD isn't terribly interesting.  It plays like an episode of Showtime's "Red Shoe Diaries", except without any titillating elements.  All you get is the goofy music, exotic yet curiously drab locales, slo-mo effects of her walking along the beach, road, or whatever, and a lot of pretentious voice-over narration.Not too many years ago, Brooke exuded a deliciously sexy pixie-ish quality.  But now she is a tad overexposed, pun intended.  An all-nude Playboy layout in 2001 revealed her newly ripped and bosom-enhanced body, but failed to capture the sexuality that made her so remarkable in her earlier modeling years.This DVD is another confusing step in her quest to be the ubiquitous Uber-babe.  But it is too much style, not enough substance.  You really would need to be a die-hard Brooke junkie to be pleased with this disc.  It is "too much" and "not enough" all at the same time.I was quite taken with Brooke when I first discovered her around 1995.  So it pains me quite a bit to have to say less-than-flattering things about this vanity project of hers. But this video seems to have little purpose other than just getting her face on your TV screen.  And the superfluous Enrique Eglasias video at the end?  Cheesy.
summary: Who exactly is this video for?
Title: Barely Brooke

reviewText: Brooke is a beautifuf woman there is no doubt. But this film is just boring. If you want to see her look to Playboy. If you want to see tropical hot spot see a travel agent.
